title: Rom Header root
description: The root of the ROM Header file

console.title: Console specification
console.description: A string specifying the console that will run this program.
console.$comment: "SEGA" at the start is mandatory, standard values are "SEGA MEGA DRIVE" or "SEGA GENESIS"

title_overseas.title: Title (overseas version)
title_overseas.description: Title for the alternate regions from the initial release (normally the same as the first one)

serial.title: Serial number
serial.description: Normally in the format "GM 00000000-00" - where GM is the initials of the developer, and the zeroes are numbers under any system you like.

checksum.title: Checksum
checksum.description: Checksum of the ROM after 0x200 - disregarded by MD hardware, but can be generated

io_support.title: IO Support
io_support.description:
I/O Support
- J for Joypad support
- 6 for 6-button pad support (if using the extra buttons)
- 0 for Master System controller support
- A for analog controller support
- 4 for Multitap support
- G for Lightgun support
- L for Activator support
- M for mouse support
- B for trackball support
- T for tablet support
- V for paddle support
- K for keyboard or keypad support
- R for RS-232 support
- P for printer support
- C for CD-ROM (SEGA CD/MEGA CD) support
- F for Floppy drive support
- D for ?

rom_start.title: ROM Start Address
rom_start.description:
Start address for the program ROM - in almost every situation it should be 0x000000.
If not specified, default value of 0 will be used.

rom_end.title: ROM End Address
rom_end.description:
End address for the program ROM - in almost every situation it should be equal to the last addressable piece of the ROM before any mirror or internal address range.
If not specified, value will be calculated at the end of the build to the next available ROM size.

ram_start.title: RAM Start Address
ram_start.description:
Start address for the MD RAM - in almost every situation it should be 0xFF0000.
If not specified, default value of 0xff0000 will be used.

ram_end.title: RAM End Address
ram_end.description:
End address for the MD RAM - in almost every situation it should be equal to 0xffffff.
If not specified, default value of 0xffffff will be used.

have_sram.title: Have SRAM
have_sram.description: True if program expects to have access to in-cartridge SRAM

sram_backup.title: SRAM is battery-backed (Backup)
sram_backup.description: True if program expects SRAM to be battery-backed (for game saves, etc)

sram_start.title: SRAM Start Address
sram_start.description: Start address for the in-cartridge SRAM

sram_end.title: SRAM End Address
sram_end.description: End address for the in-cartridge SRAM

region.title: Region
region.description:
Region specification
- J for Japan
- U for United States
- E for Europe
